SEARCH
Package upei.project

Class Player

java.lang.Object
upei.project.Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the Monopoly game. Each player has a name, balance, position on the board, list of owned properties, and a strategy.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor to initialize the player with a name, ID, and strategy.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name, int id, Strategy strategy)
      Constructor to initialize the player with a name, ID, and strategy. The player starts with a balance of 750 and position at 0.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player
      id - The unique ID of the player
      strategy - The strategy the player will follow during the game

      Returns the number of properties owned by the player.

      The number of properties owned by the player

      public void setPosition(int position)
      Sets the player's position on the board.
      Parameters:

      public void setBalance(int balance)
      Sets the player's balance to a new value.

      public void addSpace(Space space)
      Adds a property to the player's list of owned properties.
      Parameters:
      space - The property to be added

    • isInJail

      public boolean isInJail()
      Checks if the player is currently in jail.
      Returns:
      true if the player is in jail, false otherwise

    • toggleJailStatus

      public void toggleJailStatus()
      Toggles the player's jail status between in and out of jail.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the player's state to the initial conditions. The player's position, balance, and owned properties are reset.

    • acquireProperty

      public boolean acquireProperty(Property property)
      Attempts to acquire a property if the player has enough balance and the property is not already owned.
      Parameters:
      property - The property to be acquired
      Returns:
      true if the property is successfully acquired, false otherwise

    • takeTurn

      public int takeTurn()
      Simulates rolling two dice and returns the total sum of the dice rolls.
      Returns:
      The total of the dice rolls

    • makePayment

      public boolean makePayment(int value)
      Attempts to make a payment. If the player has insufficient balance, their balance is set to zero.
      Parameters:
      value - The amount to be paid
      Returns:
      true if the payment is successful, false if the player has insufficient funds

    • acceptMoney

      public void acceptMoney(int amount)
      Accepts money and increases the player's balance by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount of money to be added to the balance

    • considerBuyingHouse

      public boolean considerBuyingHouse(Property property)
      Considers whether to buy or upgrade a property based on the player's strategy. If the strategy allows, it attempts to acquire the property or upgrade it.
      Parameters:
      property - The property being considered for purchase or upgrade
      Returns:
      true if the property is purchased or upgraded, false otherwise

    • tryUpgrade

      public boolean tryUpgrade(Property property)
      Attempts to upgrade all properties of the same color group if the player owns at least 3 properties of that color. The player must also have enough balance to pay for the upgrades.
      Parameters:
      property - The reference property used to determine the color group
      Returns:
      true if the upgrade is successful, false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the player's current state, including name, position, and balance.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the player's state

    • getStrategy

      public Strategy getStrategy()
      Returns the player's strategy, which determines their behavior in the game.
      Returns:
      The player's strategy
